org.s2let
Class AxisymmetricWaveletTransform

java.lang.Object
  org.s2let.AxisymmetricWaveletTransform

public class AxisymmetricWaveletTransform
extends Object

Class to encapsulate the data and information of a axisymmetric wavelet transform.

protected  int firstScale
          The first scale to use for the wavelets.
protected  boolean multiresolution
          Multiresolution flag, true if the wavelets are calculated at different resolutions corresponding to their bandlimits.
protected  boolean reality
          Reality flag, true if the spherical harmonic coefficients in fact all correspond to real signals (wavelets) on the sphere.
protected  int scaleCount
          The number of wavelets, which depends on the bandlimit and the wavelet parameter.

          The wavelet parameter for the transform, i.e.

Field Detail

f_wav_lm

protected org.bridj.Pointer<org.bridj.ComplexDouble> f_wav_lm
The content of the decomposition, i.e. spherical harmonic coefficients of the wavelet scales.

f_scal_lm

protected org.bridj.Pointer<org.bridj.ComplexDouble> f_scal_lm
The content of the decomposition, i.e. spherical harmonic coefficients of the wavelet scales.

bandlimit

protected final int bandlimit
The bandlimit of the decomposition, i.e. of the spherical harmonic coefficients of the wavelets.

waveletParameter

protected final int waveletParameter
The wavelet parameter for the transform, i.e. the parameter for the tiling of harmonic space.

firstScale

protected final int firstScale
The first scale to use for the wavelets.

scaleCount

protected final int scaleCount
The number of wavelets, which depends on the bandlimit and the wavelet parameter.

reality

protected final boolean reality
Reality flag, true if the spherical harmonic coefficients in fact all correspond to real signals (wavelets) on the sphere.

multiresolution

protected final boolean multiresolution
Multiresolution flag, true if the wavelets are calculated at different resolutions corresponding to their bandlimits.

getNthScaleBandlimit

public int getNthScaleBandlimit(int n)
Method for computing the bandlimit of the Nth scale of the decomposition (useful in the multiresolution case).

Parameters:
n - the index of the scale
Returns:
the bandlimit of the scale

fromMWMap

public static AxisymmetricWaveletTransform fromMWMap(PixelizedMap f,
                                                     int waveletParameter,
                                                     int firstScale,
                                                     boolean multires)
Factory method to construct a axisymmetric wavelet transform from a pixelized map by doing the spherical harmonic transform and tiling the harmonic space to construct the wavelets.

Parameters:
f - a pixelized map, either in MW or Healpix format
waveletParameter - the wavelet parameter for the wavelet transform
firstScale - the first scale to be used in the wavelet transform
multires - the multiresolution flag, i.e. true if all wavelet scales need to be constructed at the resolution corresponding to their bandlimit
Returns:
a new instance of the spherical harmonic transform

fromHealpixMap

public static AxisymmetricWaveletTransform fromHealpixMap(PixelizedMap f,
                                                          int waveletParameter,
                                                          int firstScale,
                                                          int bandlimit)
Factory method to construct a axisymmetric wavelet transform from a pixelized map by doing the spherical harmonic transform and tiling the harmonic space to construct the wavelets.

Parameters:
f - a pixelized map, either in MW or Healpix format
waveletParameter - the wavelet parameter for the wavelet transform
firstScale - the first scale to be used in the wavelet transform
bandlimit - the bandlimit of the spherical harmonic decomposition
Returns:
a new instance of the spherical harmonic transform

fromHarmonics

public static AxisymmetricWaveletTransform fromHarmonics(SphericalHarmonicTransform flm,
                                                         int waveletParameter,
                                                         int firstScale,
                                                         boolean multires)
Factory method to create a new axisymmetric wavelet transform through an exact tiling of harmonic space, from an input spherical harmonic transform (using S2LET native methods).

Parameters:
flm - the input spherical harmonic transform
waveletParameter - the wavelet parameter for the wavelet transform
firstScale - the first scale to be used in the wavelet transform
multires - the multiresolution flag, i.e. true if all wavelet scales need to be constructed at the resolution corresponding to their bandlimit
Returns:
a new instance of the spherical harmonic transform

getNthScaleHarmonics

public SphericalHarmonicTransform getNthScaleHarmonics(int scale)
Get the spherical harmonic transform the the Nth wavelet in the decomposition

Parameters:
scale - the scale of interest
Returns:
the spherical harmonic decomposition of the wavelet scale

computeNthScaleMap

public PixelizedMap computeNthScaleMap(int scale,
                                       SamplingScheme sc,
                                       int nside)
Get the map (MW or Healpix) of the Nth wavelet in the decomposition

Parameters:
scale - the scale of interest
sc - the flag of the sampling scheme
nside - resolution of the map
Returns:
a pixelized map corresponding to the wavelet scale

computeNthScaleMap

public PixelizedMap computeNthScaleMap(int scale,
                                       SamplingScheme sc)
Get the map (MW or Healpix) of the Nth wavelet in the decomposition

Parameters:
scale - the scale of interest
sc - the flag of the sampling scheme
nside - resolution of the map
Returns:
a pixelized map corresponding to the wavelet scale

reconstructHarmonics

public void reconstructHarmonics(org.bridj.Pointer<org.bridj.ComplexDouble> flm)
Reconstruct the spherical harmonics of the signal corresponding to the wavelet transform

Parameters:
flm - the spherical harmonic transform
